Class DefaultPlotContext

java.lang.Object
com.arbergashi.charts.internal.DefaultPlotContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
PlotContext
public final class DefaultPlotContext extends Object implements PlotContext
Default PlotContext implementation.

Computes high-precision transformations between data and pixel spaces. The allocation-free mapToPixel(double, double, double[]) method is the hot-path.

Since:
2025-06-01
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Arber Gashi

      public boolean isLogarithmicY()

      Specified by:

    • mapToPixel

      public void mapToPixel(double dataX, double dataY, double[] dest)
      Description copied from interface: PlotContext
      Transforms data coordinates into pixel coordinates.

      Zero-Allocation: The result is written into the provided array.

      Specified by:
      mapToPixel in interface PlotContext
      Parameters:
      dataX - X value (data)
      dataY - Y value (data)
      dest - Array of length at least 2. out[0] = pixelX, out[1] = pixelY.

    • mapToData

      public void mapToData(double pixelX, double pixelY, double[] dest)
      Description copied from interface: PlotContext
      Allocation-free inverse transform: pixel -> data coordinates. Writes the result into dest[0]=dataX, dest[1]=dataY.
      Specified by:
      mapToData in interface PlotContext

    • getTheme

      public ChartTheme getTheme()
      Description copied from interface: PlotContext
      Theme associated with the current rendering context.

      Framework contract: This must be non-null during rendering. Implementations that do not manage per-panel themes should return a stable default such as ChartThemes.getDarkTheme().

      Specified by:
      getTheme in interface PlotContext
